title: Palak Paneer
instructions: First, blanch the spinach, then puree it. Sauté onions, garlic, ginger, and tomatoes. Add spices like turmeric, cumin, and coriander. Mix in the spinach puree and simmer. Finally, add cubes of paneer and a splash of cream. Cook for another 2-3 minutes and serve hot.

title: Paneer Butter Masala
instructions: Sauté cashews, onions, tomatoes, and ginger-garlic paste. Blend into a smooth puree. In a pan, melt butter, add the puree and spices like red chili powder and garam masala. Cook until the gravy thickens. Add paneer cubes and a generous amount of cream. Simmer for 5 minutes.

title: Aloo Gobi
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden. Add ginger and garlic. Stir in potato and cauliflower florets. Add powdered spices like turmeric, coriander, and chili powder. Cover and cook on low heat until vegetables are tender.

title: Vegetable Korma
instructions: Boil mixed vegetables like carrots, peas, and green beans until tender. Make a paste of cashews, coconut, and onion. In a pan, heat ghee, add the paste and sauté. Add yogurt and spices. Mix well. Add the boiled vegetables and water to form a gravy. Simmer until creamy.

title: Mushroom Matar
instructions: Sauté sliced mushrooms until they release their water and brown. Set aside. In the same pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds, and chopped onions. Cook until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree. Add spices and cook into a gravy. Add the mushrooms and peas, and simmer for 10 minutes.

title: Dum Aloo
instructions: Prick baby potatoes and deep fry until golden. Set aside. Make a gravy by sautéing onions, tomatoes, and a blend of spices. Whisk yogurt and add it to the gravy, cooking continuously. Add the fried potatoes to the gravy, add water, and simmer on low heat (dum) for 15-20 minutes.

title: Vegetable Pulao
instructions: Wash and soak rice. In a pressure cooker or pot, heat ghee or oil. Sauté whole spices like cinnamon and cumin seeds. Add sliced onions and cook until golden. Add mixed vegetables like carrots and peas. Stir in the soaked rice, salt, and water. Cook until the rice is done and fluffy.

title: Tomato Rice
instructions: Cook rice and set aside. In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, and let them splutter. Sauté onions until translucent. Add ginger-garlic paste and chopped tomatoes. Cook until the tomatoes are mushy. Add spices like turmeric and chili powder. Finally, mix in the cooked rice.

title: Saag Aloo
instructions: Boil and cube potatoes. Blanch and chop spinach. In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped garlic. Sauté for a minute. Add onions and cook until soft. Add the chopped spinach and cook until wilted. Stir in the boiled potatoes and spices. Cook for another 5 minutes.

title: Onion Pakoda
instructions: Thinly slice onions. In a bowl, mix flour (traditionally gram flour, but regular works), chili powder, turmeric, and salt. Add the sliced onions and a small amount of water to create a thick batter that coats the onions. Heat vegetable oil for deep frying. Drop spoonfuls of the batter into the hot oil and fry until golden and crisp.

title: Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani)
instructions: Marinate chicken pieces in yogurt and spices. Grill or pan-fry until cooked. For the gravy, blend tomatoes, cashews into a smooth puree. In a pan, melt a generous amount of butter, add the puree and cook. Add spices, cream, and a little honey or sugar. Add the cooked chicken and simmer.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, and spices like garam masala and paprika. Skewer and grill until charred. For the sauce, sauté onions, ginger, and garlic. Add tomato puree and spices, and cook into a thick gravy. Stir in cream. Add the grilled chicken pieces and simmer.

title: Simple Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil, sauté chopped onions until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute. Add pureed tomatoes and cook until oil separates. Add powdered spices like turmeric, chili powder, and coriander. Add chicken pieces and sauté for 5-7 minutes. Add water, cover, and simmer until chicken is cooked through.

title: Mutton Rogan Josh
instructions: Heat ghee in a pressure cooker. Sauté mutton pieces until browned. Add whisked yogurt mixed with Kashmiri red chili powder and other spices. Cook until oil separates. Add water, salt, and pressure cook until the mutton is tender. The gravy should be rich and red.

title: Egg Curry
instructions: Hard boil eggs and peel them. Make a few slits in the eggs. In a pan, heat oil and lightly fry the boiled eggs until golden. Set aside. In the same pan, make a gravy with onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, and spices. Add water and bring to a boil. Gently add the fried eggs and simmer for 10 minutes.

title: Chicken Biryani
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and biryani masala. Separately, par-boil basmati rice until 70% cooked. In a heavy-bottomed pot, layer the marinated chicken and the par-boiled rice. Top with fried onions, mint leaves, and ghee. Cover and cook on low heat (dum) for 25-30 minutes until everything is cooked through.

title: Keema Matar
instructions: Heat oil, sauté whole spices, then add chopped onions and cook until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste, then add the minced mutton (keema). Cook until the keema is browned. Add powdered spices and chopped tomatoes. Cook well. Add peas and a little water. Cover and cook until peas are tender and keema is cooked through.

title: Gajar ka Halwa
instructions: Grate carrots. In a heavy-bottomed pan, cook the grated carrots in milk until the milk is almost fully absorbed. Add sugar and continue to cook until the mixture thickens. Add ghee and cook for another 10-15 minutes until it gets a rich color. Garnish with chopped almonds and cashews.

title: Fruit Chaat
instructions: Chop a variety of fruits like apples, bananas, and oranges into bite-sized pieces. Place them in a large bowl. Sprinkle with chaat masala (a tangy spice mix), a pinch of black salt, and a squeeze of fresh lemon juice. Toss gently to combine. Serve immediately.

title: Boondi Raita
instructions: Soak boondi (small fried chickpea flour balls) in warm water for 5 minutes to soften them, then gently squeeze out the excess water. Whisk yogurt until smooth. Add the soaked boondi, roasted cumin powder, a pinch of chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Garnish with fresh coriander if desired. Chill before serving.

title: Aloo Paratha
instructions: Boil and mash potatoes. Sauté chopped onions, add mashed potatoes and spices like chili powder and cumin. Knead flour into a soft dough. Take a small portion of dough, flatten it, place a spoonful of the potato filling, and seal it. Roll it out into a flat circle. Cook on a hot tawa (griddle) with ghee or butter until golden brown on both sides.

title: Paneer Tikka
instructions: Cut paneer and bell peppers into cubes. In a bowl, mix yogurt with spices like paprika, cumin, and garlic powder. Add the paneer and vegetables to the marinade and let it sit for at least 30 minutes. Thread the paneer and vegetables onto skewers. Grill or pan-fry with a little oil until they are slightly charred.

title: Instant Rava Dhokla
instructions: In a bowl, mix flour (traditionally semolina/rava, but all-purpose works for an instant version), yogurt, and a little water to form a thick batter. Let it rest for 15 minutes. Add baking soda and mix well. Pour the batter into a greased steaming plate and steam for 10-12 minutes. For tempering, heat oil, add mustard seeds, and pour over the dhokla. Cut into squares and serve.

title: Aloo Tikki
instructions: Boil, peel, and mash potatoes. Add breadcrumbs (from your bread), chili powder, and salt. Mix well to form a dough. Shape the mixture into flat, round patties (tikkis). Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the tikkis until they are golden brown and crisp on both sides. Serve hot with ketchup.

title: Mango Lassi
instructions: In a blender, combine chopped ripe mango, yogurt, milk, and sugar. Blend until smooth and creamy. If it's too thick, add a little more milk. Pour into glasses and serve chilled. You can garnish with a pinch of cardamom or pistachios if you have them.

title: Watermelon Juice
instructions: Cut watermelon into chunks and remove the seeds. Place the chunks in a blender and blend until smooth. Strain the juice through a fine-mesh sieve to remove any pulp. Stir in a pinch of salt or a squeeze of lemon for extra flavor if desired. Serve immediately over ice.

title: Banana Milkshake
instructions: In a blender, combine ripe bananas, cold milk, sugar, and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Blend until smooth and frothy. Pour into tall glasses and serve immediately. You can drizzle with honey or chocolate sauce if you have it.

title: Simple Sponge Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time, adding a little vanilla. Gently fold in the flour and baking powder. Pour the batter into a greased and floured cake tin. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a skewer inserted into the center comes out clean.

title: Shahi Tukda
instructions: Cut bread slices into triangles and deep fry in ghee until golden and crisp. For the rabri (sweet milk), boil milk until it thickens and reduces to half. Add sugar, condensed milk, and nuts. Dip the fried bread triangles in a light sugar syrup, then pour the rabri over them. Garnish with more nuts.

title: Honey Glazed Almonds
instructions: In a non-stick pan over medium heat, toast almonds for 2-3 minutes until fragrant. Reduce the heat to low. Drizzle honey over the almonds and stir continuously to coat them evenly. Add a pinch of cinnamon or paprika for extra flavor. Cook for another 2 minutes until the honey bubbles and thickens. Spread on a plate to cool completely.

title: Coconut Laddoo
instructions: In a pan, combine desiccated coconut and condensed milk. Cook on low heat, stirring continuously for 5-7 minutes until the mixture thickens and starts to leave the sides of the pan. Let the mixture cool slightly until it's comfortable to handle. Grease your palms with a little ghee and roll small portions of the mixture into round balls (laddoos).
